comment: Lecturing style didn't click with me as much- english isn't her first language. She uses very simple language in her lectures and I often ended up bored in class- good thing is there were many resources for studying. Offers practice before quizzes that I found very helpful- studying was mandatory for me. A lot of mandatory in class participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: I feel as though some of the negative, bad reviews were from students that were wanting an A/B handed to them. But like with other science classes, you have to work for your grade. I have her for lab and she's very sweet. Offers help when needed and gives a clear rubric to each assignment. I would definitely recommend her for lab!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is kind but just reads off slides so it can get a bit tiring, test are multiple choice, & lowest gets dropped. Two group projects which are super easy! Homework has 2 parts a quiz and regular hw .She gives lots of extra credit opportunities as well. Just study and you will be fine the class isn't hard just lots of terminology.

Biol3370Lab, no rstudio only excel. Most of the assignments were done in group or with a partner. Real easy and chill lab. There are no pre/post lab quizzes, just the assignments/reports for the lab done.

She is not the worst that could be taken, its an easy class that doesn't feel heavy. She has 3 exams & a final, she drops the lowest. 2 group projects that are very easy. The hw is done through the macmillan achieve site and they are also easy. She only reads off the slides so you kind of teach yourself. good amount of extra credit/bonus points

Professor Afroza is an okay lecturer, she reads off the slides, which can be dull. Homework is easy, and she offers lots of extra credit. Exams are general, so if you attend class and study, you'll do fine. Group projects help your grade. Easy grader, but effort is still needed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Tbh her class was js alright. Her lectures aren't the best but you gotta show up for the cred. Study the ppts since most of the test questions bring up things mentioned in ppts. Pearson assignments due right b4 the tests. Submit work ON TIME bc she doesn't accept l8 work. Tests are in person and u only have a 15 grace period to get there.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her lectures are vague since she mostly reads off the slides. The homework load is heavy and adds extra stress when the material isn't clear. She mentioned adjusting final grades if they were close to the next letter grade, but this didn't happen for me. I passed with an 89, which could have been a 90. Clearer lectures would help a lot.

Her lectures and long and pointless other than the fact that she does in class pop assessments that are graded. She gets mad easy and will show it. 4 tests and 4 lab quizzes, pretty easy if you follow the study guide.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Actually took her for lecture, not lab. Her slides were too vague and did not correlate to exams. I was pretty much learning from the textbook the whole time.

This professor came off as nice in the beginning, but throughout the semester she often called out certain students for not doing anything, and get upset when nobody answers her questions. Class gets out at different times every day, and she will end class if she becomes too upset. She yelled at us a few times, though nobody could really understand

Hard to understand as she has a very thick accent and does not speak very loudly. She interupts her lectures to call students out. Her tests are all in person on paper and there is homework. She has lab quizzes but the labs arnt required or graded. Attendance was taken like twice via writing your name on a paper.

Will read straight off the PowerPoint for lectures, cool, fine. But rude to her students, has no authority over them, she assigned a lot of work, and she very clearly doesn't know what she's doing. Highly unorganized as well. She should not be teaching.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Horrible, horrible, horrible, Does not speak english so hard to understand also gets stumbled upon easy asked questions in class. Literally just reads power point this is the last professor you want for biol

She's nice to me, a little awkward. She has an accent, but not that hard to understand.  If Biology is not your major, I would not suggest her. You will get a 100 on tests if you read the textbook, study and do the homework. Lectures are pointless because the test is not based off of the lectures. Attendance is mandatory, but there bonus on tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: She has a heavy accent, only reads off of slideshows and doesn't explain any further in detail. Gives random attendance grades at the end of class and also ends classes at random times. She also offers no support or help and gives off the appearance that she doesn't care about or respect her students at all, but tests are easy if you took APES.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: When I was in her class, I was going through some of my lowest points and there was no remorse or even a response to my cries for help. She has a heavy accent and just read from the PowerPoint the whole time, so sitting through her class was so painful. Her tests and Quizzes are stupid, and don't you dare miss one of her attendance grades. Don't.

Eh. She's kind of rude and you can't understand a WORD she says. VERY easy class but still it feels pointless. I wouldn't take her again but it'd be fine if it's necessary or last second. If you don't have to take her, don't. Attendance "isn't mandatory" but she does a bunch of in class stuff for grades and if you miss it, you can't make it up.

Her accent is strong and the test are super hard. Lectures don't help with exams, read the textbook. Don't take her unless you have to. Lots of busy work as well with mastering weekly and group activities. I feel like she makes the class harder than it should be with her exams having very critical thinking questions and being on paper.

such a bad teacher- she just reads her slides word for word in class and then gets mad if you don't pay attention, calls you out and insults you if you don't understand or walk in late, you can't understand a word she says but then  gets mad when people don't respond to her questions, and you don't get tests back.

easy class i would only take again if the course was easy because she is a bad professor. is strict with her rules, lots and lots of lecture non stop and is bad at explaining harder material. she laughed one time when like 5 kids said they understood the lecture and moved on from the topic. some extra credit, test are easy due to study guide.

She's not the worst but CERTAINLY not the best. She started off ok but got worse. She was nice in the beginning but now she's super rude. She's unorganized and blames it on the students. I think that she's knowledgable about the subject that she teaches but she just maybe shouldn't teach. She does nothing but read off powerpoint and yells about HW.

This professor has personally been one of my worst experiences at KSU. She would drown us in powerpoint which would not have much correlation to any assignments or tests. Got by the class only by going over study guides instead of lectures due to feeling I learned better that way. I would not recommend
Very pointless lectures, softspoken and no one could hear her. She's nice, but that's kind of it
She is really cool but it was hard to understand her sometimes with her accent but beware of R-studio as it is sometimes really difficult to navigate. Overall not too bad to handle

She cares about her students and is passionate about the topic. I felt bad for her because everyone was giving her a hard time even though it was her first semester teaching. Attending class was pointless due to the material being basic, mainly vocab. She can be hard to understand sometimes due to her accent. Everyone doesn't give her a chance.

3 exams, 3 lab quizzes, 10 Pearson assignments, and a final. She is very caring and wants everyone to succeed. While she has an accent that can make it difficult to understand her, she posts the PowerPoint online and purposely makes the exams easy. She also makes study guides/reviews for the tests! Easy if you study, I ended with a 97.

Would not take this class again. lectures were very pointless, reads straight from the powerpoint. Tries to make her class more difficult by never giving a straight answer. Ends lectures 40 minutes early when she gets upset. Doesnt care much for her students. Lies about extra credit to get people to show up. Study guides are not very helpful.

This was her first semester teaching and it was very evident. The class is very disorganized and she doesn't have authority over her students. The lecture hall often makes it very hard to hear, as she has a heavy accent. The tests were difficult and hard to study for, and her classes were no help either. Study on your own and you should do well.

The teacher is passionate about what she teaches and she knows what she is teaching. However, her accent and teaching style does not work for me. She also miscommunicates and she isn't fully transparent with students.

Every class was her reading off PowerPoint slides, which could get very boring at times and she has an accent so sometimes it's hard to understand her. All you have to do is study and do the homework, most of the test questions can come from the homework. She always gave a study guide for our tests and it was fairly easy to make quizlets with it.

This was a difficult class, not because of the material, but because of the teacher. She will drown you in PowerPoint slides and she is hard to understand due to a very thick accent. The majority of this class was the students working together to try and make a coherent study guide for the tests because of how bad she was at relaying information.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a good teacher, just reads off the board most of the time so pay attention. She posts the powerpoints and give hw assignments before the test date. The tests aren't hard just do the homework on time and pay attention. Only con is that she doesn't speak loud enough and the class room is pretty big... so it can be hard to understand her.
